column2: Execute targeted communications to our internal business unit stakeholders to increase awareness of compliance responsibilities         Collaborate with team lead and internal business unit stakeholders to ensure monitoring processes and training versions are up-to-date with client requirements         Monitor the enrollments and completions of client-mandated training through the use of reports and analysis tools         Monitor execution of client-mandated reporting activities with business unit stakeholders to mitigate risk of non-compliance         Perform monthly reconciliations to report training compliance to internal management stakeholders         Maintain and centralize organized records to be made available for client audits         Maintain centralized resources to ensure information is up-to-date with recent client contracts         Perform other duties and engage in projects as assigned                   Qualifications:               Bachelor s degree in business-related or legal field         Office skills must include the ability to use standard office equipment and demonstrate an intermediate level of Microsoft Office to include but not limited to Excel (pivot tables and VLOOKUP formulas required), Outlook, and Word.         Candidate with prior experience in compliance/audit or process management preferred, particularly in pharmacovigilance or billing compliance         Hands-on working knowledge of contract management preferred         Strong organization skills and attention to detail to accurately handle multiple job duties accurately         The ability to prepare data by compiling and analyzing internal and external information         The ability to maintain discretion in handling confidential information         Must be able to work both independently and within a team setting
column11: Manager Internal Audit, Contract management, Consulting, Management consulting, Financial planning, Market research, Healthcare, Marketing strategy, Monitoring, Process management
